intro: Triumfetta dubia, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Triumfetta dubia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
